game.name: Quick Cross
game.history: Quick Cross was created by the Great American Trading Company in 1997.
game.board: The game is played on a 4-row, 4-column board with a cross-shaped slot in each space.[img src="a.svg" alt="a" width="300" height="300"]
game.pieces: There are 16 chips total, each of which either player can place on their turn. All chips are off the board at the start of the game.
game.tomove: Either place a chip on the board in either a horizontal or vertical direction, or change the direction of an already-placed chip.
game.towin: Be the first to create a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal line of four chips that are either all horizontal or all vertical.

variant.name: Misere
variant.description: The objective is to force your opponent to create a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal line of four chips of the same orientation.

references.reference: Quick Cross: The Strategy Game. The Great American Trading Company. 1997.
